mcframework.core.SimulationResult#

class mcframework.core.SimulationResult(results, n_simulations, execution_time, mean, std, percentiles, stats=<factory>, metadata=<factory>)[source]#

Bases: object

Container for the outcome of a Monte Carlo run.

Attributes:
resultsndarray of float

Raw simulation values of length n_simulations.

n_simulationsint

Number of simulations performed.

execution_timefloat

Wall-clock time in seconds.

meanfloat

Sample mean \(\bar X\).

stdfloat

Sample standard deviation with ddof=1.

percentilesdict[int, float]

Map of computed percentiles, e.g. {5: ..., 50: ..., 95: ...}.

statsdict

Additional statistics from the stats engine (e.g. "ci_mean").

metadatadict

Freeform metadata. Includes "simulation_name", "timestamp", "seed_entropy", "requested_percentiles" and "engine_defaults_used".

Parameters:

  • results (ndarray)

  • n_simulations (int)

  • execution_time (float)

  • mean (float)

  • std (float)

  • percentiles (Dict[int, float])

  • stats (Dict[str, Any])

  • metadata (Dict[str, Any])

Parameters:

  • results (ndarray)

  • execution_time (float)

result_to_string(confidence=0.95, method='auto')[source]#
Return type:

str

Pretty, human-readable summary of the result.

Parameters:

  • confidence (float)

  • method (str)

Prints the dictionary attributes in a readable format.

Parameters:
confidencefloat, default 0.95

Confidence level for the displayed CI.

method{“auto”, “z”, “t”}, default "auto" Which critical value to use ("auto"

chooses based on n).

Returns:
str

Multiline textual summary.

Parameters:

  • confidence (float)

  • method (str)

Return type:

str

Notes

The CI in the string is

\[\bar{X} \pm c \frac{s}{\sqrt{n}}\]

where \(c\) is either a z or t critical value depending on method.
